content.webTitle: Vandevelde swoops on Republic fashion chain

fields.headline: Vandevelde swoops on Republic fashion chain
fields.bodyText: Change Capital Partners, Luc Vandevelde's private equity investment group, has bought a majority stake in Republic, a deal which values the UK fashion business at £105m; the 76-strong chain specialises in young labels such as Hooch, Bench, Replay and G-star. Change bought a minority stake from rival 3i, and got control by buying Republic management shares. Mr Vandevelde set up Change just prior to leaving as chairman at M&S; he is backed by the Halley family, owners of 11.5% of the Carrefour empire. Other Change UK holdings are Robert Dyas and blind manufacturer Hillarys.
